label: 両側町
対訳語: townships which were formed geographically by rows of shops and residences lining both sides of a street
本: Cities in Medieval Japan. ACTA ASIATICA, 44 . The Tōhō Gakkai . 1983
説明文: Cities came into existance through the formation of townships (chō) which were formed geographically by rows of shops and residences lining both sides of a street (ryōgawa-chō 両側町), each building owner paying rental fee (yajishi 屋地子) calculated not by total land area but by the length of street frontage occupied. [町][SS]
